intro: Stizolophus balsamitifolius, commonly known as the Balsam-leaved Stizolophus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft, velvety texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom in the spring and early summer.
